dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HRES 88 IH: Amending the Rules of the House of Representatives to prohibit the consideration of any bill or joint resolution that appropriates foreign assistance for more than one country.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Poe of Texas (for himself, Mr. McClintock, Mr. Westmoreland, Mr. Rohrabacher, Mr. Coffman, Mr. Clay, Mr. David Scott of Georgia, Mr. Cohen, Mr. Diaz-Balart, Mr. Sherman, Mr. Higgins, Ms. Ros-Lehtinen, Mr. Faleomavaega, and Mr. Cotton) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the Committee on Rules

form.official-title: Amending the Rules of the House of Representatives to prohibit the consideration of any bill or joint resolution that appropriates foreign assistance for more than one country.

section.text: That rule XXI of the Rules of the House of Representatives is amended by adding at the end the following new clause:

rules-clause.rules-clause-header: Limitation on foreign assistance for more than one country
rules-clause.text: It shall not be in order to consider any bill or joint resolution that appropriates foreign assistance for more than one country.
